alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Greensville (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 12:19PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Northampton, southwestern Greensville and southeastern Brunswick Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1218 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gasburg to 8 miles southwest of Roanoke Rapids. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Brunswick around 1230 PM EDT. Roanoke Rapids and Barley around 1240 PM EDT. Garysburg and Gaston around 1245 PM EDT. Dahlia and Seaboard around 100 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Mud Castle, Ante, Brink, Gum Forks, Triplet, Henrico, Vultare, Valentines, Slates Corner and Pleasant Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
